What is the truth of suffering?

The suffering of birth, the suffering of old age, the suffering of sickness, the suffering of death, the suffering of grief and sorrow, the suffering of separation from what is loved, the suffering of encountering what is disliked, the suffering of not obtaining what one desires, and the suffering of the five aggregates that fuel attachment.
The suffering of birth refers to when a person, according to their actions, enters a womb and is born, their form appearing, their faculties entering and growing.
Old age refers to when a person's faculties mature, their form changes, their hair turns white, their teeth fall out, their muscles slacken, their skin wrinkles, and they walk bent over with a cane.
Sickness refers to the illnesses caused by a person's sinful actions, such as boils, sores, abscesses, pus, epilepsy, insanity, and chronic illnesses, also numbering over a hundred kinds.
Death refers to when a person's life ends, their form decays, their warmth dissipates, their breath ceases, and their spirit departs.
These are all suffering.
What is the truth of the origin [of suffering]?

It means that the mind of lust delights and gives rise to affection, the will is in greed and desire, causing further leakage, and the multitude of practices flourish and become attached, binding oneself.
What is called love is the eye loving forms, the ear loving sounds, the nose loving smells, the tongue loving tastes, the body loving smoothness, and the mind loving desires;

But only observing their permanence and delighting in expectation, how can it be beneficial? Calling it mine, one becomes attached and binds oneself. From this, the love for the five aggregates of form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness becomes intense, seeing them as permanent and desirable, calling them mine, and becoming attached, binding oneself.
What is called form is the spirit's reception of the qi of earth, water, fire, and wind, transforming into a body;

Because of attachment and love, it causes the eye consciousness to be attached to forms, the ear consciousness to be attached to sounds, the nose consciousness to be attached to smells, the tongue consciousness to be attached to tastes, the body consciousness to be attached to smoothness, and the mind consciousness to be attached to dharmas, believing it to be the truth of practice.
What is called the truth of cessation?
Not accepting or entering, with the complete extinction of craving, the bonds are already untied, as one who sees with wisdom does not have any more.
People in the world have nothing to see, attached to the five aggregates;
Counting is already exhausted, the bonds of craving are completely untied, already following the wisdom that sees impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and non-self, this is the truth of cessation.
What is called the truth of the path?
It refers to the eightfold right path: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.
What is called right view?

Right thought also has two aspects:

Right speech also has two aspects:
Not engaging in divisive speech, not engaging in harsh speech, not engaging in false speech, not engaging in frivolous speech, is right worldly speech;
Separating from the four verbal faults, reciting and chanting the words of the path, not creating anything in the mind, completely without remainder, is right speech of the path.
Right action also has two aspects:
Bodily action that is good, verbal action that is good, mental action that is good, is right worldly action;
Bodily and verbal effort, mental thoughts of emptiness and purity, dissolving and extinguishing attachment, is right action of the path.
Right livelihood also has two aspects:
Not killing, stealing, or engaging in sexual misconduct, not being arrogant, cultivating virtue and guarding oneself, this is the correct governance of the world;
Separating from the three evil deeds of the body, eliminating suffering and craving, extinguishing love and seeking liberation, this is the correct governance of the Way.
Correct livelihood also has two aspects:
Seeking wealth through the Way, not being greedy or deceitful, not deceiving others with a false mind, this is the correct livelihood of the world;
Separating from wrong livelihood, abandoning worldly divination, not violating the precepts of the Way, this is the correct livelihood of the Way.
Correct intention also has two aspects:
Not being jealous, not being angry, not engaging in wrong practices, this is the correct intention of the world;
Separating from the three evil deeds of the mind, practicing the four right efforts, being pure and unconditioned, this is the correct intention of the Way.
Correct concentration also has two aspects:
Having a pure and disciplined nature, guarding goodness and being firmly at peace, the mind not being crooked or deviant, this is the correct concentration of the world;
Attaining the four intentions, only emptiness, no-thought, and no-wish, seeing the source of nirvana, this is the right concentration of the Way, this is the truth of the Way.
